response.improvementExplanation: In this context, repartition(1) is used to reduce the number of output files to 1. However, since repartition(1) involves a full shuffle, it is more efficient to use coalesce(1) for reducing the partitions without shuffling the data.
response.benefits: Switching to coalesce(1) will reduce unnecessary shuffling, leading to improved resource usage, faster job runtime, and better performance.
